artist: Artist: Unknown Japanese; Artist: Tsuba by Ōmori Terumasa
description: sword set: metal blade with snake decoration and 3 peg holes in tang that has also a gold lacquer signature; signed tsuba with soft metalwork decoration of dragon amidst waves; grip is wrapped, dragon head on tip, 2 silver menuki in form of a tiger on one side and a lion on the other; lacquer scabbard with horimono (metal decoration) at end in form of dragon wrapped around sword, gold and silver mounts; fabric tie
inscription: on blade in gold lacquer: 長識 {Chōshoku} plus seal
medium: Metal, gold, silver; tsuba: gold, shakudo overlaid and carved shibuichi
signed: on tsuba: 幹支間　英昌 {Kanshiken Terumasa} plus seal
title: Blade with engraved snake for a long-sword (Koto-katana) and mounting with dragon decoration
